text: Pours hazy mango into a shaker. Bright white head with good retention recedes to skim surface. Mango and passionfruit aromas. Soft with sweet marshmallow, lavender and mango upfront turning to sweet mandarins and tangerine in the lasting finish.

Can, dated 5/31, picked up at tree house on 5/31. This is the second can Ive enjoyed (first the night of the release). I was pretty excited to have this the same day it was canned. Taste the same as then, so I guess it doesnt need to be enjoyed right off the line. Hazy gold pour, thick sticky white head, great lacing. Aroma is big on tropical fruit -- I drank this with mango sticky rice from one of my old haunts in Ithaca, and theres totally something like a mango-melon marriage going on here. Hints of cat litter early on, but that gets swallowed up by the tropical cocktail. Moderate sweetness, very light bitterness - hazy juice ipa here for sure. Smooth, soft supple texture, full body, appropriate carbonation. Overall: damned tasty.

Nice fruity juice mostly of citrus, orange, grapefruit, some tropical fruits, mango, peach, nice pine and some herbal aspect. Moderate to light sweetness with moderate bitterness.
Awesome balance.
Nice DIPA. Cloudy golden appearance. A bit mild in taste. But balanced in general
Yellow hazy with medium white head. Nice citrus aroma. Good bitterness with sweet-sour citrus notes. Lasting mild bitterness.

Can
Aroma-fruits
Appearance-golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good
Haze for me is exactly the type of beer i imagined would come from TH. Robust, creamy, dank and well balanced. Its just fun and sexy.

Canette datée de 6 semaines environ. Robe jaunâtre très trouble et surmontée dun léger col de mousse blanc. Arômes de pamplemousse blanc, mangue et levures, effluves de pâtisserie, herbes fraîches, crème au pêche. En bouche, mangue et clémentine, orange, pamplemousse léger, légère résine, sucre de pêche. Finale mélangeant sucre de fruits et légère amertume de grains maltés. Texture juteuse et corps moyen.

Puszkowane 2 tygodnie temu. Czuć lekkie utlenienie. W aromacie owoce cytrusowe (przede wszystkim pomarańcza, trochę mniej grejfruta), jeszcze mniej anansas, papaja. Taka mieszanka cytrusowo-tropikalna z dominacją tych pierwszych. Coś jednak poszło nie tak.... to nit jest to czego się spodziewałem po tym piwie i browarze. Piwo płaskie bez wyrazu, nie powala aromatem, trochę słody psują całość doznań. Wciąż to czołówka stylu, ale wcześniej ustawiona wysoko poprzeczka, zobowiązuje. Mam nadzieję, że to tylko problem z jedną warką....

16 oz. can thank you T.J. Hazy bright gold appearance. Aroma shows me soft pale grain, mild mango, and underdeveloped yeast. What the hell?? Not what I was expecting from this Brewer. 

Flavor starts out with weak mango and pineapple. White bread, honey and maybe light grapefruit that lingers on the finish. Too malty to balance the hops, sweeter than I would have guessed. Carbonation is a bit over done with a lively feel. Body comes off a bit spritzy. The yeast seems tired and not developed. Have they pushed this yeast strain to the limit? Seems like Tree House now only wants to push out the beer because they cant keep up with production. Premature ejaculation.

Poured from can dated 3/22/17 hazy lemon orange with a nice white head. Aromas of caramel malt citrus floral notes and pine. Taste is sweet caramel lingering bitterness and some citrus. Something is amiss here. I would not wait in line for this beer. I dont know of there is something wrong with the yeast or the brewery is too focused on pushing out beer than focusing on a quality product. Might want to focus on coitus interruptus.

16 oz can shared by voodoofishusf75. Pours a hazy golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have big juicy citrus, oranges, tropical fruits, pale malts, good mouthfeel, light bitterness, very solid.

Tasted from can. Pours a cloudy gold with thick rocky white head. Incredible fruity aroma. Lots of orange with some grapefruit and lemon. Incredibly balanced. Flavors of orange, peach, grapefruit, pineapple with some floral and resin notes. Extremely drinkable. Incredible IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tree House Haze. Pêssego nas alturas aqui. Perfeitamente equilibrada. 4.25/5

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

ugly murky yellow small head
smells like sauerkraut scallions lemon some tropical rotten notes some earthy notes
tastes bitter like orange pith
feels kind of prickly but also kind of flat
i dont get the hype for this murky turd nugget

Wellp, not much really to say about this one. Its literally perfection. Absolutely the most tropical thing imaginable. Super drinkable and smells like the freshest tropical fruit blended up. Taste is like juice and smooooooth. Absolutely world class, it doesnt get any better. Short and sweet, get this beer somehow.

16 oz poured into Tiku glass attained in trade. Nice less pulpy orange character compared julius. great orange with a hint of grapefruit and floral herbiness. I get quite a bit of peach on this compared to other treehouse beers. just a noticeable hint of alcohol. Really fantastic.

Can shared at Cotteridge Wines cheers to Jaz and Andrew Harries; cloudy yellow pour with a creamy white head, aroma has solid pine and mango pulp, taste has really smooth citrus, decent pine, mango, orange squash.
Super crushable NEIIPA. So glad I got to try some. Thx for the can Terry and Emma.
Can. Hazy orange colour with white head. Citric and tropical fruit aroma. Sweet, citric, tropical fruit, juice and caramel taste. Medium body.

Oliver (Brew Your Mind Brewery) gifts from the USA. Thanks again! @ Budapest.

Hazy orange you cant see through with a white head. Amazing citrus hop sharp and challenging with out being over bearing. Very juicy.

Orange juice pour with a bright white head. Great lacing. Aroma is orange juice, mango, and some pine. Taste is orange juice, tropical fruit, pine, and dank. Smooth bitterness. Lingering grapefruit aftertaste.Creamy texture. Very easy drinking. Fantastic.
This is my one and only favorite beer in the world. Superb in all the things. Endless supply, please.

Very hazy golden white color. Frothy white. Grapefruit and mangoes in the nose. Modest bitterness and alpha acid. Very well balanced but drinking this with lots of other NE IPAs and I gotta say this in no ways stands out or slightly below the (very high) average.
Thanks Carl! Pretty awesome full bodied NE juicy IPA. Orange and peach. Hint of booziness that was pleasant with sweetness. Yum.
Cloudy tropical NE beer, Thats just too good to miss out, i love this beer!

16oz can. Pours a cloudy grapefruit-juice-colored straw-orange with a smallish white head. Aroma is big grapefruit, some resiny pine, and a little bit of mango. Taste is a ton of grapefruit up front followed by light pine and other, softer tropical fruits. Gentle finish. Moderate, lingering bitterness. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Pillowy, oily finish.

I suppose this would be my first ever "juice-bomb" that Ive tasted. It was canned today, and pours really hazy, a very pale orang colour with thin white head. Aroma is nice, very powerful. Juicy (orange, mango, peach), also a hoppy/floral scent as well. It has a really nice scent. Taste is juice. Ive never had a beer like it, that tastes so smooth and flavourful. It hides its ABV content and really just goes down easy. I do prefer beers with a more hoppy/floral bite to them, but to each their own. Really nice beer Im happy to have. Skål

Floral and citrus, grapefruit, aroma. Hazy, yellow orange color. Medium to medium heavy palate with warm alcohol finish. Head dissipates quickly. Alcohol cuts carbonation. Pine, herbal, earthy flavor with crisp and bitter melon, orange, and grapefruit. Big citrus aroma and flavor in hops.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle share @ Hampton Inn pre-DLD 2016. Pour is hazy amber with a medium white head. Notes of fruity hops, dank tropical fruit and citrus with soft carbonation.

Can at home. Pours hazy and quite bright yellow with a good off white head. Aroma is very tropical, and so are the taste, but with citrus and grapefruit added to it. Incredible smooth and easy to drink, no alcohol present. Great beer!

3/XI/16 - 1Pt. can @ 50/50-tasting (50% of the bottles are in the top 50 of their own beer style), ElMananas place - BB: n/a, canned: X/7/16 (2016-1280) Thanks to ElManana+1 for sharing the can!
Sixth top 50 beer of the tasting!
Cloudy blond to orange beer, creamy white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: fruity, grapefruit, pretty floral, bit sweet, malty, grains. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: pretty sourish, lemony, lots and lots of grapefruit, slightly sweet. Aftertaste: pretty bitter, bit resinous, lots of grapefruit, citrus, little sweet.

Can shared by Sean. Thanks man! It pours a very hazy yellow/orange color with an off white head. The aroma has lots of sweet melon and over ripe papaya. Super tropical. The flavor has more big melon notes, papaya and other creamy tropical fruits. Guava maybe? The mouth feel is creamy and soft. This stuff is so tasty and crushable. Dangerous.
Pours a very hazy orange-peach color, with minimal head. Aroma is bursting with citrus and hops. Flavor is a very strong grapefruit-citrus, with lots of hop bite. Really good beer.
Can, 4 days old. Hazy bright orange, huge tropical nose, some distinct papaya and pineapple. Incredibly light for the abv, huge fruit notes with dank notes. Very easy and quite exceptional.

16oz can via Facebook trade. Poured New England style. Aroma is tropical and citrus fruits, wet dough and bread crusts. Flavor is bitter hops, fruity rinds, bitter citrus, bread crusts and dry grains. Bigger body, harsh bitter finish with a slight touch of heat and softer carbonation throughout.

Release du 12/02/2016.  Une bonne dose dherbes qui donnent un petit buzz, ananas et mangue, beaucoup de jus dagrumes et de trucs tropicaux quon mange presque jamais. Les saveurs sont moins concentrées sur les fruits, comme le nez finalement après quelques bonnes gorgées, avec ses flaveurs dherbes et sa touche doignon, son filet dail, sa pincée de terre. En bouche, le corps est mou et crémeux. En finale, cest une amertume de houblons, des cocottes, la tige, les huiles avec une sensation exotiquement juteuse.

Tao at brewery. Pours a hazy bright golden amber. Aroma is citrus and tropical fruit notes, light spice, pale malt, oats, and faint notes. Flavor is pale malt, huge citrus hops, light pineapple, some dank/pine, and some light spicy alcohol notes. Medium body.

Draft at the brewery. Pours opaque orange gold with a thick, frothy off white head. Tastes like grapefruit hops, resin, smooth booze, some lemon and orange, and caramel and bready malt. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like grapefruit hops, resin, bready and caramel malt with light spice, and orange.

16oz can from the Brewery: This one pours a milky, darker straw yellow color. There was about a finger of a frothy off white head that leaves some lacing. Very nice nose. Orange, pineapple, peach, maybe some earthiness. The taste is excellent. A fairly good amount of bitterness. Orange, pineapple, a bit of resinous hops. Good malts in the background.
Can aquired in a trade, shared at 50/50 trade. Hoppy, juicy, bit malty, not too impressed with this one actually.

Really hazy peach color with off-white head. Aroma has really juicy hops with nice tropical flavors. Taste is even more intense. Lots of peaches and apricots, mango, some pineapple and a good amount of grassy bitterness on the finish. Full bodied and well carbonated. Another great one from Tree House.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2017 2nd time Tree House went Head to Head with Trillium and lost. Not by much at all, mind you, but still...
Hazy darker orange pour. Juicy nose as expected of papaya, passionfruit and citrus. Flavor much the same with low bitterness and little showing of the abv. Popping with more peach the second time around and kicked Maharajas ass.

Can shared. Bright orange pour, very hazy, with a medium height tan head. Notes of tropical fruit, unripe mango, papaya, peach nectar and a bit of honey. Medium body, smooth texture and a hoppy bitter-sweet finish.

Pours hazy gold with a small white head. Aroma is orange, floral, resin and more orange....juicy. Taste is mild bitters with acidic citrus coming through. Medium bodied, slick with good carbonation and some drying on the finish. Excellent.

Pours a muddy peach pour with a white head. Nose is the same Tree House hop cocktail of rotted stone fruits, various hop aromas, and orange juice. Mouth is heavy and overly sweet and boozy. Hop influence is actually very nice, with some funky and rotten notes (Nelson?). Heavy and "round" as I always find these big Tree House IPAs. Not my thing, but others may love it.

Pours a cloudy golden orange color with a foam head that laces my glass. The aroma is very earthy, has notes of grapefruit, and sweet tropical fruit. Tasting there is a pleasant citrus flavor. I enjoyed the balance of sweetness and bitterness. The bitterness was clean, it lingering nicely but wasnt too intrusive. The body was medium to low medium with a good carbonation. Overall a rather well done double ipa.

Can into a wineglass showing unfiltered dark orange with sparse white foam. 

The nose shows intense juicy grapefruit and orange citrus notes. 

The palate is full bodied and well carbonated. Flavors of intensely juicy grapefruit and orange citrus with a light barely perceivable bitterness on the finish. Similar to the other beers a mix of sweet malts and the citrus notes create a light adzuki sweetness on the finish. Superb

16oz canned JUL2016 imported by Giles, big thanks for stopping by! - "We constructed this beer" which is not an IPA or DIPA - no, its an "Imperial Pale Ale" - yes, apparently hazy IPAs are a New England branch of speciality engineering now and by the looks, mouthfeel and maybe flavour of it this Keller of a PoMo-DIPA includes more than hop oils squeezed out with precision and unfiltered yeast: unmalted wheat, wheat flour, corn starches?   -  Pours like mango buttermilk, smells like it too, as well as perfumed like room vaporiser, brand pineapple, passionfruit and blood orange juice - sweet and radiantly fresh. Proteins add a near-chewy mouthfeel I am very fond of. The dank pine notes add bitterness that feels instrumental in adding crispness and definition to the fruity hop oils among the wheaty malt cushions, not foregrounded to shock and awe or bludgeon taste buds into submission. Memorable, since fresh. #TerribleNewBeautiesofHeadyToppersBorn
Can: Poured a hazy yellow. Aroma is tropical hoppy. Taste is juicy hops a lot of tropical passion fruit.
Can. Pour is cloudy, hazy gold. Aroma and flavor citrus and floral. So clean and pure.
Tasting at Eugenes; canBlond color. Hazy. Fresh and very juicy, sweet with wisdom, not too bitter.Delicious.

(Cannette provenant de la brasserie): Un gros pourcentage du bouquet rappelle la mangue, purement et simplement. Un aspect plus herbacé tente de se faire une place également. Le corps est entier, juteux et la finale est sèche, presque crayeuse et teintée dagrumes pales.

750mL growler filled 8/5/16 and drunk 8/25/16.Despite almost three weeks in the fridge, this guy still poured a thoroughly hazy, golden-brass with a big, pillowy, white head showing strong retention. Ok, the name checks out (not that I thought it wouldnt).Lots of key lime, strong watermelon/honeydew and a big, honey-laden maltiness that easily balances things. Tangerine juice, mango and very light pineapple are all complemented by a fresh minerality that is a very pleasant house character of the yeast/water, just as it is with Hill. No resin, flaw, alcohol and a great balance between malt and hop with no resin. Good intensity to the nose, as well.Succulent malts are well-attenuated, and provide plentiful honey notes in concert with a tight carbonation. Pineapple, watermelon, lush vegetal greenery and light strawberry. Malts easily balance the relatively low bitterness and lime and pineapple linger pleasantly on the finish, with a touch of spiciness. Not really a standout in their insanely high quality arsenal, but I think thats much more about how high quality all of their beers are and less a comment on this particular one. It is intensely soft and malty and I could see a bit more bitterness adding a bit more brightness and crispness on the end.
Delicious. Hard to beat. Probably the best double Ive had in a long time. Thanks.

Can. Pours a heavy cloudy light golden orange with a lasting thick foamy off white head. Aroma is of passionfruit, mango, caramel, floral, orange. Taste is of mango, passionfruit, orange, pineapple, butterscotch. Oily mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation.

From the 16 oz. can dated Aug 24, 2016. Hazy yellow pour underneath a modest white foamy head. The head lingers. Nice aroma of orange, peach, citrus, and toasted biscuit and bread. The body is in the medium range but it is so darn smooth like all of their beers. The tastes focus is on the peach and fruitiness but the toasted biscuit introduces itself in a more subtle way. But the fruitiness defines it. Really nice.
Pungent citrus zest hop funk to the smell. Hazy orange you cant see through with a white head. Amazing citrus hop sharp and challenging with out being over bearing. Very juicy.
Fruity. Mango. Tropical fruit. Juicy but dry. Pineapple. Thx thepatrickman.
OK, pretty awesome, almost creamy with soft head and a full palate slight bitterness. A new fave.
Can. Tasting @ Bibere-Piraeus. Color hazy orange with medium white head. Aroma citrus, hops, pine, orange. Taste sweet citrus, orange, melon, bread.

Thanks Drew.
This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance lived up to its name, definitely orange haziness colored with a fingers worth of white foamy head that leveled off at a nice pace. Sly thin lacing forms around the sides evenly.
The aroma starts off with a bright and juicy orange juice, pulpy with big bitter balancing rind-like qualities. Sweet onion dankiness slides in for an extra ferocity of the aroma.
The flavor brings it all together bittersweet with a spectacular orange juice to sweet onion aftertaste. Excellent sweet to danky finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium in body with a smooth sweet to bitter feel rolling over my tongue. Nothing clings, just feels absolutely awesome as it hits my tongue.
Overall, hot damn, what an absolutely amazing DIPA. I would definitely have again.

Can @ Monkish. Cloudy golden-orange beer with a finger of soapy white foam. Nice tropical fruits (mostly pineapple), pine, and oily citrus on the nose to start. Theres a bit of underlying sweetness here, but its fairly mild. The flavor starts off with a lot of citric hop character such as grapefruit and orange, but theres a pretty strong pineapple juice thing going on, too. Moderate bitterness and a slightly oily finish. Kind of heavy on the tongue.

16oz can. Murky golden orange with a creamy off-white head. Flavors are sweet cereals, passion fruit, resinous hops and orange zest with grassy and light dank notes. Light warming alcohol, but never boozy. Medium body, soft to moderate carbonation carbonation, silky texture.

Can, 1 pint. Hazy golden with a frothy offwhite head. Intense aromas of fruity hops, pine, light alcohol. Medium to full bodied, moderate carbonation. Smooth and creamy. Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Rich malty and floral hoppy flavors into an astringent hoppy finish.

Can, 1 pint. A cloudy amber beer with a medium size white head. Aroma of tropical hops amd some pine. Taste is medium bitter and medium sweet. Medium bodied, thin, with faint carbonation and some astringency. Nice hoppy character and slightly alcoholic finish.

Growler fill from the source. Drank within 24 hours of getting it from the brewery. Pours hazy yellow unfiltered NE ipa fruit juice, white head. Aroma is super dank, lots of mango and tropical fruit, orange, tangerine. Awesome. Flavor is. Wow. That might be one of the best beers Ive ever tasted. Flavor is white peach, orange, tropical fruit. This flavor is straight up fruit juice. Nice soft mouthfeel. Wow. Its actually a totally unique IIPA for me (havent had much from Tree House). This is one of the best Ive ever had. This is the first time Ive given a 10 for flavor. Im as blown away as can be.
Aroma- Fruity hoppy, smooth Appearance- cloudy orange ligh Taste- very floral, hoppy, and fruity. Well balanced.Great

Can. Hazy yellow pour with a firm head. Lots of grass, pine and resin in the flavor that seemed to cover up all the citrus and passion fruit I was hoping for from the desription. The alcohol is fairly forward in this one. Decent, but not my favorite.

Pour from a 750 ml growler shared by Ryan at Chris house - thanks again, Ryan! Pours a hazy marigold with a small white head that settles into a bubbly ring an dfilm. Notes of lemon and lighter grapefruit citrus, pine, wildflowers, pineapple, doughy malts, orange rind, and stone fruits. Medium-bodied, with moderate to medium carbonation and a fruity, bitter mouthfeel. These hazy IPAs are all the rage these days, and I guess the one named Haze is mostly to blame for it. The well-made ones are delicious, and this one is no exception. Im annoyed by the basic feeling that "haze = good" by the new money beer bro crowd as it relates to IPAs, and Im worried about the wave of imitators and pretenders that will be flooding the market with low-quality knock-offs of Tree House and its peers. Well see. For now, Ill just enjoy this.

Can, much thanks to Harrison. Pours out that hazy orangy color with a small white head. Aroma is of lots of juicy orange juice, grapefruit, light tropical juicy notes, some soft malt notes. Taste is pretty awesome, juicy citrus, orange juice, grapefruit pulp, some dank hops, light tropical juicy notes, low on the bitterness and high on the juice. Really nice.

August 29, 2015. Growler. 
Hazy orange with a medium sized white head. Aroma is juicy, fruity and dank with mango, pineapple, peach, grapefruit, orange, hints of grass and crackers, light herbal notes. Taste is light to medium sweet, juicy and fruity, smooth bitterness. Finish is sweet fruity with mango, orange, peach, smooth bitterness with some grass notes, dank and herbal. Medium bodied, slight oily texture, soft carbonation. 
Amazing, fruity, juicy, creamy and sooooo drinkable!

Can sample at a tasting at Alexey & Raphaelas place. Thanks Alexey & Raphaela. Cloudy yellow with a big white head. Lovely hoppy aroma, "green", full of tropical fruits, some citrus, a bit of onion. Dry flavor with lots of juicy fruity hops, a bit "green", and mild bitterness. Medium-bodied. Great stuff, very refreshing.

Purple can shared by someone tonight, thanks. 
Hazy murky pour with a minimal head. Huge tropical fruity earthy pine and resinous hop. Not much in the way of bitterness but it does linger in the finish. Sweet bready malt is moderate. Tasty but ugly beer.
Can shared at Todds. Big nose with juicy flavors citrus tangerine hazy tropical. Good.

Not a big fan of the aroma, but that scent is quickly forgotten after a sip. Not hard on the palate and don't let the hazy appearance fool you, it goes down smooth with a good aftertaste 

Fredo

Pours a very hazy straw colour with a small dense head. Aromas are real mellow but at the same time lingering piney hop aromas. Some perfumy fruity hues, some very earthy almost dank hues. Very enjoyable nose. Taste is initially tropically fruity and hoppy with some resin and herbal notes developing. Dangerously drinkable at 8%. Mouthfeel is medium with low to medium carbonation. Aftertaste is citrusy initially, turning more towards a lingering darkness and finishes dry. Great IPA!

The pour of this is pretty darn hazy (you dont say?) yellow, with a small white head. 
Aroma is pretty delicious with all kinds of fruity stuff like passion fruit, pineapple juice and mango juice, but also has plenty of citrus peel and dank grassy greens. Plenty amounts of hoppy goodness In this bad boy. 
Taste is pretty darn bitter, with some fruity juicy sweet notes to it. 
Medium bodied, with a very lively/sparkly/pricking carbonation. Definately delicious

Au premier coup doeil, comme plusieurs produits issus de la même brasserie, la bière nest pas très appétissante. On reluque un liquide marécageux de couleur jaunâtre avec une petite mousse blanche qui laisse toutefois une fine dentelle derrière elle. Au niveau des autres sens par contre, cest magique. Des pêches, des ananas et dautres fruits tropicaux valsent dans les narines sans retenue. En bouche, cest tout aussi fruité as fuck avec un corps rondelet et un léger sucre résiduel qui naliène aucunement la ribambelle de fruits qui paradent sur le palais. Lamertume est très discrète et la buvabilité de cette bière est extrême.

Can @ Himmeriget . Sample from Henrik and Theis - Thanks! Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of sweet mango, juicy pineapple, dank herby hops, passion fruit, orange and slight floral notes. The taste is dank, juicy and has lots of tropical fruits and citrus notes in general. Goes down SO smooth. Would love to drink a whole can of this.
Can @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Cloudy light golden pour with a generous head. Juicy hops, stone fruit, lemon peel, light grape fruit with a subtle bitterness. Really good!

Can shared @ Himmeriget by Henrik. Thanks! Pours a damn hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is grassy, fresh hoppy, tropical fruits, dank, peachy. Taste is fruit juice, lots of hoppy notes, dank, tropical but pretty low bitterness. Drinkable as fok.

Aroma- floral and hoppy, smooth not bright
Appearance- cloudy citrus light Amber
Taste- very floral, hoppy, and fruity. Well balanced. Really delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Murky golden orange. Big aroma of fruit wafts from the glass. Citrusy and juicy, flavour is fantastic but even more yeasty than some of the other tree house beers. All great.
Poured a cloudy, orangey-gold. Smelled of hops and various light fruits. Incredibly drinkable and super smooth and soft on the mouth.

Can. Cloudy yellow with medium white head. Fresh citrus aroma bursting with orange and some tropical fruits. Medium body, minimal alcohol, some carbonation. Intense juicy hop flavor with a ton of citrus, some yeast, just a touch of malt, flowers, focused on the hops yet complex. Fantastic.
Hazy yellow pour. Nose is grapefruit, piney, fresh water. Taste is big grapefruit, piney, more citrus. Smooth oily mouthfeel. Best Tree House IPA Ive had.

Can shared by KyotoLefty. A lovely cloudy gold with a filmy white head. A fantastic hoppy bouquet, dank, resinous, citrus peel. The taste is light soda bread malt character, bright citrus zest, resinous and wonderful. I dug it though that could also have been the huge contrast between this and the high ABV monster dark beers we were drinking.

Can. big tropical fruit nose, durian, mango, wheat. Cloudy yellow with lace. Dank flavor, lots of Mosaic, grapefruit, stinky durian, zest. Great stuff. not even a vague sense of that sweet syrupy nonsense I often find in the style.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2016 Can, about 7 weeks old so maybe fallen off. Lightly cloudy yellow. Nose is garlic, with some distinct orange juice notes. Taste follows. Mineral with full mouthfeel and grapefruit pith bitterness.

>>Rerate-bumping up from 3.9.  Another can, still about 6 weeks old this time from thepatrickman, but a lot more orange citrus and generally just juicier with less garlic.  I think my palate was off for initial rating as everything was garlicy that night in a big IPA lineup for me.

Can, four weeks old, by way of trade with Rich182. Cheers Rich! Cloudy, dark yellow. Film of dense, sticky, white head. Nose has fusty, chewy orange hop. Lots of resin. Sweet and dank. Huge, fresh hop. Behind that, theres a sweet, grainy, vanilla maltiness. Taste is chewy, resinous sweet. Turns full on, citrus zest, hop oil, bitterness. Soft, rich, smooth palate. Massaging carbonation. Long, zesty, oily bitter finish. The drinkability is outstanding.

Can shared. Very hazy golden orange with an off white head. Aroma of grassy hops, tropical fruits, lychee, peach and caramel malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

50cl can courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thin white head. Very cloudy blond pour. lovely bitterness. Very good

Can. Pours Golden haze with off white head. Aroma is fruity pineapple, orange, papaya and grapefruit. Taste is sweet fruity grapefruit, papaya, pineapple with a piney hop finish. They kick out some damn fine beers. Wish i lived closer and had easier access to it.
Shared 16 ounce can. Pours a hazy pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, and floral. Taste is pineapple, grapefruit, orange, peach, floral, and malt. Super!

Can - Pours hazy golden with a foamy white head. Nose is dank onion and citrus, light, crackery malt, and pear and mango. Tastes like orange juice with a little pear, mango, and other tropical and stone fruits. A little soapiness, and just a hint of light pale malt. Thick and oily, with ample carbonation. Yummy.

Can at the main DC December Gathering. Poured a dark, murky yellow color with a small off-white head. Aroma was grapefruit notes, light citrus. Some tropical fruits and nice floral hop character. Touch of peach? Pretty solid.

Can at Ryans and again at Franks December 19th, 2015. Pours a golden orange body with thick white head and lacing. Nose is juicy tropical notes, fresh citrus and faint dank character. Mouthfeel is creamy and smooth, full bodied, with notes of juicy tropical fruits, stone fruits, oats, nectarines, orange pulp and bitter dry hop profile towards the finish. Great stuff from Tree House.

World Class DIPA. I tried this at a tasting that included MBC Dinner, Heady, Second Fiddle, Trillium, and a bunch more, and this was one of the best ones of the whole lot. Huge fruit and grapefruit smell and taste, and fantastically well balanced with the hop bitterness and malt sweetness. Really cloudy appearance is both cool for the style and a little visually unappealing. Phenomenal.

[ can ][ 1.5oz ][ @Tasting ][ $ ? ][ schnapps flute ][ 12.20.15 ]tepid straw honey. Doughy TH-esque grassy hops, muted with faint dough. Front palate light lime, more doughy muddle, finishing oily and sticky, sweet vegetal green notes, some plasticity, creamy.

Cloudy yellowish orange pour. Nice fluffy white head. Big citrusy flavors up
Front, tropical fruit, unripe stone fruit, well balanced with a nice malt bill.

16oz can pours a murky yellow gold with some creamy, white head. Nose is juicy tropical fruit, mango, guava, some perfume. Flavor has muddled fruits, grassy, perfume, some dough, guava. Creamy finish. Fine, drinkable but I dont know what the hype is all about.

Pours an opaque tan/orange with a medium white head...nice foamy lacing. Aroma has fresh pine...like a fresh xmas tree...some grapefruit, tangerine and pineapple. Flavor follows suit...adds subtle stonefruit, more citrus and rindiness...but fresh piney/sprucey notes take center stage. Mouthfeel is medium and just a bit sticky...finish is dry and piney/rindy.

First Review - but what a good Beer
Aroma - Citrus, Orange, very large, very nice
Appearance - I like the appearance - not sure what is bad 
Taste - lightly sweet but with the aroma it is a blast of orange
Palate - Crisp but medium body, slightly oily but good hops oils
Overall - One of the Tier 1 IPAs in the world, Looking for juicy Orange followed by nice hops burps (yes you know what I am talking about)
From a can at the Ratebeer Dec 22 gathering 2015. Pours a cloudy goldwit an off white head. Citrus nose. Flavors of mandarin orange. Tasty.

Can courtesy of solidfunk, who waited for five hours for the privilege of buying it. Cloudy, almost murky straw color. Gorgeous aroma of pineapple, grapefruit, tropical fruit. Taste is nicely balanced bittersweet tropical fruit. Delicious.

Can at the DC December Gathering #2. Purple label, so purple haze, get it? Thanks solidfunk. Murky yellow with off-white head. Aromas of orange and grapefruit citrus, floral, tropical fruit. Tastes of floral, citrus, tropical fruit. Medium body with a dry finish.

can shared by a friend. poured a cloudy light golden colour with a white head. nose has lots of fresh citrus, lemon zest, floral hop notes, and caramelized malts, orange, and some slight sweet melons. taste has a strong floral hop bitterness, bread malts, sweet melons, and a clear alcohol notice. tropical fruit juice, and grass hops. taste is creamy and full, but a bit to "hot" i like their ipas a lot more with a bit less abv. but this is still world class.

Pour out of 16 oz can, thanks to Solidfunk! Very hazy (appropriate) orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of big tropical fruit, lots of pithy apricot, peach, some pineapple, touch of orange and grapefruit. Taste was a mix of nice passion fruit, pineapple, peach, hints of apricot, nice mango note as well into some grass, spice, finishing bitter, dry. Very well made.

Hand delivered direct from brewery. Poured from 16 oz can. Pours hazy golden peach color with off white head. Aroma of fresh cut hay, sweet pineapple, and grapefruit. Amazing dank aroma that Tree House always provides. Flavor is fresh tangerine, pineapple, passion fruit, fresh slightly under ripe mango, with grapefruit and a dank pine finish. Oily mouth feel. Amazing. Big Thanks to Maxbier for sharing.

Glad Im still not in bloody line waiting for this but at least its good. Tangerine, grapefruit peel, mango and passion fruit. Pours hazy golden. Wonderful mixture of flavors here. Sweet bitter and tangy finish, in equally balanced parts. Can bought today from the source.

16 oz Can purchased at the source today. Hazy golden pour with white head. Grassy tropical citrus aroma. Green grassy up front very fresh hop character with some tropical sweetness to balance. Finish is citrus and more grassy hop. Absolutely delicious DIPA.

16 oz. can. Originally reviewed 6/13/2015.

Smell is orange and kinda tropical. Sweet smelling

Tastes of orange, grapefruit. Sweet caramel. Lots of booze in it too. Less tropical here, more sweet pale malt and orange.

Medium heavy. Creamy mouthfeel.

Tasty, but too sweet and boozyfor me to hit the heights of othe Tree House hoppy beers.

Milky pour yields a bright clementine, fully hazed appearance. Weedy, vegetal acridity in the early aroma; pulpy, dandelion glue, milkweed. Tropical fruits and pastry dough malts providing some calming sweetness, astringent green bitterness holding firm. It would seem to be violently rough, but its not, its just so grassy, so green. Moments of angel food cake and honeycomb become more common over time, theres enough balance here.

The flavor finds much of the same conflict, though leaning toward pulpy sweetness now and not so much to the pushy astringency. Unripe mango, sweet pine, white peach, green banana. Thin, sweet malts. The real issue might be the silty, mucky suspended yeast flavor; a mixture of wet clay, riverbed, chlorine. Mingling with the residual sugars, this sensation is extremely distracting, and very difficult to describe. 

Soft palate though highly carbonated, medium to heavy weight. Objectively desirable flavor and aroma components are undermined by the intangible mess of drinkability issues here; this is a prime example of the huge gap that exists between whats truly great and whats generally perceived to be great. Treehouse is a world-class brewery, but some of its offerings arent fun or easy to drink.

This poured a murky golden. color with a white head. Aroma was big juicy peaches and other stone fruit, light resin. Flavor similar, but much more pronounced, orange, peach, grass and passionfruit. Awesome

Can in a trade. Pours a cloudy pale orangey yellow with a white head. Aromas of juicy peach, guava, and cantaloupe. Taste has some of that Julius crazy melon juice action but more subdued and a tad more orange or tangerine. Not as sweet and very well balanced. Cleans up on the palate quite well. I need to visit Tree House now.

Thx to PriorL & Mathieu87. Can sampled @ "De grote Black Tuesday  Tasting". They recently purchased this one @ the brewery so this one should be FRESH. Hazy milky golden with a creamy white head. Nose is oinion, big smoothie yeast & stone fruits. Taste is yeast smoothie, floral, onion, hay, exotic fruit, reasonably bitter resin, touch sweetish bread. Boyd is yeast smoothie. A very fashionable modern style USA IPA, slightly reminiscent of what Trillium makes. Nice.

Nearly clear orangeish-golden beer with a good, slightly yellowish head. Grapefruit, exotic fruit, bit of ureum, very inviting nose. Bitter/ish, bit metallic, lots of exotic fruit and resing. Well carbonated, bit harsh finish, medium bodied at least. Harsh, but good.   Txs to the Vermeersch bros!

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2016 **I rarely re-rate things these days as it would be a full-time job to do so, but I think this deserves it as Ive had it a few times since during beer shares and it seems to get better with each batch. My original rating seemed very low, but the review part is still on. Smell and taste are top notch to me and this has quickly become a favorite beer of mine. Its too bad that its so damn hard to obtain. 

Can. Pours a bright cloudy yellow orange with a sudsy white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, hop oils, pungent and dank. Flavor has juicy grapefruit and orange, peach, pine, light onion hints, bitter. Medium to full body, sticky and thicker texture, lively carbonation, bitter bite on the finish. Another hit from Tree House, as usual for me.

Cloudy orange gold with thin foamy lacy beige head; aroma is hoppy notes of crude oil and pine; flava is bitter oil hoppy and tangy fruit notes; feels medium with fizzy zing near end; finishes bitter herbal hoppy

Growler. Cloudy apricot hue with a fluffy head of white. Aroma has grapefruit peel, peppercorns, a little melon, star fruit, resin. The flavor has less going on, leading with grapefruit pith and finishing with a hint of peach in a surprisingly clean, dry and mild finish. Tiny bit of cracker malts. Medium-light, watery body; very soft carbonation; big lingering bitterness.

16oz can. Chewy hazed golden little head. Piney onion with some faint tropical hops. Chewy feel, garlic and onion forward hops. Malt bill is simple like the others Ive had. Just not a fan of the hops here, personally.

Juicy citrus nose, pine and dank soft malt base. Literally smells like all the other ones I've had tonight more or less. White sugar Also. Great looking hazy orange nice head and lace. Juicy citrus dank pine resins white sugar a little onion. Mild sweetness a touch of alcohol. Balanced with a mild onion finish. Solid.

Very hazy orange just one finger head. Smells rally great. A lot of pine and orange juice. Intense Abv, you can certainly taste the Abv. Orange sherbet, grapefruit and a bitterness that lasted a long time. If there was some way to get this without the alcohol intensity, its a solid DIPA.

Growler (750 ml). Shared by Simon at tasting, thanks! Hazy golden-orange with a medium white head leaving intense lacing. Aroma is intensely dank, but also intensely citrus (oranges, peaches) & tropical fruits forward. Really explosive, but it works really well. Taste is juicy and mineral with a ton of dankness again and a rather low bitterness level. Malt backbone is pretty solid and add some mild earthy spiciness. Medium body. Moderate to medium carbonation. Juicy mouthfeel. Danky finish. Not boozy at all for an Imperial IPA. Up there with the best of the style. Amazing aromatics hops and drinkability is pretty high as well! Really nice!

475 ml can at home from trade with bytemesis. Thank you Mike! Hazy golden orange color with white head. Aroma is hoppy, juicy citrusy fruity, orange, light pine, light spicy hoppy, malty notes too. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma with alcohol notes. Medium to full oily body with soft carbonation.

473ml can from trade. Thanks Don. Aroma: loads of peaches, oranges and a bit of grapefruits and some shy spices. App: hazy cant see through peach with small white head and amazing lacing, similar to Julius. Taste and palate: medium body, light sweetness, extremely fruity and spicy at the same time, clean light long bitter finish. Overall: wow! This iipa doesnt have what I dislike about other iipa which is too malted. That one doesnt feel malted at all nor too sweet. And another awesome product from Tree House!

50cl can via trade. It pours a hazy rich apricot color with a medium off-white head. Aroma is big bold sweet and resinous hops, with notes of melon, grapefruit, pine cones, citrus peel, peaches, dank weed. Taste is more pungent weedy hops, pine cones, grapefruit, grass and melon. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, excellent DIPA

A pilgrimage to the brewery resulted in copping as many of 3 brews as fairness allowed, all similar in many respects and clearly sprung from the same roots. Heavy citrus nose, dense cloudy orange color, decent thick head that dissipates quickly, ample mouthfeel, a barrel full of mixed citrus flavor backed up by a full dose of not especially bitter hops... and a hint of tea. This one is distinguished by more of the tea and pine flavor and a high ABV. Excellent.

Growler shared. Hazy orange gold pour with lacy white head. Aroma is super dank, pungent, orange creamsicle and weed hops, very juicy, intense aromatic notes. Taste is so juicy, much dank, very hop, no bitter. Palate is med-full bodied with just enough carbonation. I could drink the crap out of this for a long time.

From notes. Enjoyed at the hotel for a tasting after Great Taste on August 08. Growler shared by Al. Thanks! The pour is a great brilliant yellow color with a thin film of soapy white head and some good lacing. The aroma is really good. Lots of grapefruit and various other citrus to accompany a resounding pine resin and a light, juicy hop. The flavor is just as good. There is a little pine up front, but once you get into the body it kind of tastes like OJ. Its great. Really juicy hops bring up the rear and keep everything light. The mouth feel is crisp and clean with a nice medium carbonation and a lingeringly juicy, lightly bitter aftertaste. Really good.

Sample at the Northeastern Brewery (ME/MA) Tasting on 08/09/2015. The beer is a hazy (duh) orange color with a medium white head that dissipates steadily to a film. Short strings of lacing on the glass. The aroma consists of citrus, herbal hops and malt. Medium body with flavors of dank hops, citrus and grainy malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a citrusy hop aftertaste. Pretty good all around.
Can - Tropical creamy fruit. Hazy gold. Same as it tastes with a long finish. Nice balance with bitterness.

500mL can, pours a cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma brings out notes of resinous hops, some candied fruits and light caramel. Flavour is well-balanced between resinous hops and caramel malts. Fairly sweet, but not cloying. A little sweeter than I care for in IIPAs, but its well-made. Very good.
Can thanks to Steve. Pours a hazy orange with medium creamy white head that lasts. The aroma is tropical fruit and dank. Medium mouth, juicy, dank, light pine, very nice.

Growler thanks to hackobock! Hazy orange liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, mango, grain and weed. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with notes of tangerine, mango, light bread and fresh hops. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Super good hop aroma. Very tropical and fruit. Awesome.

Can shared at The Kernel - thanks to Tommy. Pours hazy gold with a frothy white head. Big juicy citrusy hops in the aroma, pale bread, pine. Medium sweet flavor with lightly jammy citrus, orange, melon, bread, minerals. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Lightly warming and resinous on the finish, lots of plump, juicy citrus, more pale bready sugars. Great stuff overall. Well balanced. Very drinkable. Excellent.

Aroma of grapefruit, citrus, passionfruit. Pours hazy yellow with a very fluffy head. Taste of grapefruit, citric, a bit earthy, with some passionfruit and pineapple coming up. The most grapefruit forward of the Tree House IPAs, and also the most bitter.

Pour is light golden amber with lots of fluffy white head and a decent lacing. Nose is huge grapefruit rind, really rindy musk, light grain profile, clean. Flavor is the same, a little less of the rind, more tropical, very low bitterness, light body, softer carb.
Aroma is sweet tropical fruit, pine, citrus. Appearance is golden, white head. Taste is bitter, orange, rind, pine. Mouthfeel is perfect, crisp and thick. Overall, holy balls this is nice.
At the source: pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is pine, juicy fruits, hints of citrus. Resinous quite. Very juicy. Resinous finish. Very smooth. Medium bodied. Nice.

Can, straight from the source. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Orange zest bouquet. Citrusy hops run the show with muted pine backbeats. Well balanced with the perfect amount of caramel malt notes. Good body, good mouthfeel, bitter but not overly so. Damn, this one really solid DIPA.

Can shared by Troy. Nose is moderately tropical with some earthy herbal notes. Orange juice consistency and pour. Taste is lightly minty with some herbal and dirty notes. Not very citrus like. Just kinda meh. Light sweetness to it. Not impressed.
Can to glass. Pours an orange. Aroma has some tropical notes. Get some maltiness. Taste is light, dry, some hoppy notes, but not strong dank or fruitiness. Ok beer.

Very solid DIPA, but I dont feel the same sense that this is a unique representation of the style that I get from both Julius and Green. Another fruity hopped pale ale. Almost has a strawberry/banana thing going on.

Can, thanks to Reynolds314. Pours cloudy orange with a medium creamy off white head, good lacing. Aroma is very resinous, melon, orange. Flavor is light plus sweet, medium bitter. Medium body with a resinous mouthfeel.

Growler at home. Pours a murky, opaque apricot with a modest white head. Messy lacing coats the glass after a few sips. Citrus aroma--lots of orange, very fruity, a touch of passionfruit. Taste is siimilar; citrus, orange. An assertive bitterness. Soft, medium bodied, bitter finish.

Pours golden hazy orange sunset with a sandy white head. Aroma brings a soft but prevalent hop oil with no bite and a touch of lime. The flavor brings tropical fruit and a juicy body, with the hop oil at the end for sure, but I dont love that ending the way I enjoy the beginning.
Growler. Pours yellow gold white head. Nose/taste of citrus, lemon, peach and cracker malt - medium body.
Growler. Yellow pour with white bubbles. Herbal, grassy, citrus and tropical aromas. Herbal, grassy and citrus hop Flavors, fresh!
Growler fill at the brewery. Golden orange color that pours hazy. Tropical aromas and taste. Orange, tangerine, pineapple flavors abound. right up there with the best DIPAs out there in my opinion.
growler at Crabbapple bottle share. one of the best of the day. slightly hazed straw colored pour, citrusy, orange, bitterness, slight herbal/medicinal notes. really good

Pours a hazy yellow golden color with two fingers of white fuzz. Tons of melon, citrus and lingering tangerine from front to back. Juicy, soft and great balance between sweetness and bitterness. Light cracker malt plays background to this dank hop juice. Well done !

Growler cracked one day after filling. Pours hazy cantaloupe color with one finger of off-white head and great lacing. Aroma is sweet honey and melon with fragrant rose and lychee, and undercurrents of pine and dank marijuana. Taste is mega orange juice, grapefruit peel and candied melon, although more delicate and honeydew-like than cantaloupe. Some caramel malts. Clean, crisp finish of piney and woodsy hops with moderate booziness. Medium mouthfeel. Lingering bitterness. A bit aggressive and rough around the edges, but still really solid.

Taster at the source. Pours pale straw with a white head. Aroma if orange citrus. Taste is drier than green, with grapefruit citrus, dry pineapple. Slight dishwater. Grapefruit peel bitter in the finish.

Poured from growler into reservoir tip glass. Pours golden orange with a foamy white head. Aroma is all citrus, lots and lots of citrus. Taste is a citrus bomb with very little bite at the back end. Its very juicy, but somehow seems thinish. Its a good beer but not great. Light to medium body.
growler at tree house, BAM another laser show. Tons of juicy orange flavors, light bitterness and highly drinkable. A huge treat.
One of the best tree house hoppy beers. Aroma is heavy tangerine and pineapple. Tons of tropical fruit goodness. Nice grassy hoppy bitterness and a dry drinkable finish.

Growler, pours hazy golden orange with nice medium sized white head. Aroma is amazing with grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, and orange sweat. Flavor was a little cheesy at first but as it warmed became more subtle and dank with orange, tropical hop, dank resinous. A little hot but not sweating it too much. Medium body. Paired with some silver haZe. Cheers

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Hazy golden-orange body, medium to large white head, soapy lacing. Assertive tangerine, orange zest, dank florals, grapefruit, light earth. Medium bodied, semi-dry throughout, assertive bitterness, moderate carbonation, just the slightest hint of the ABV.
Growler shared by Lunch. Thanks Paul. The beer is in fact hazy. Loads of citrus character. Dank hops and oranges. Tangy with a subtle sweetness. Mild bitterness and lingering citrus. Tasty.
Hazy yellow, thin head. Flavor of bright citrus notes, juicy, light pine and floral hops. Really solid

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 750ml growler in a tulip. Pours transparent amber with a lacy, white head. Aroma of fruity and citrusy and floral hops, pale and caramel malts, and light dough. Flavor the same with a nice hoppiness. Average texture. A solid beer from Tree House. EDIT: April 2017.  Been a long time since Ive had this one.  Like almost all Tree House beers, it got better.  Its incredible how they just keep improving. 3.8 to 4.
Pours orange with a white lacing. Huge citrus notes accompanied by tropical fruits and finishing with more of a malt presence than the typical tree house beer. Finishes with some notes of alcohol.

Clear golden color, moderate white head. Somewhat muted aroma of mango, peach, orange, pineapple, and grapefruit. Very well executed sweetness, complex but not overbearing. Smooth, crisp, and softly carbed - almost light-bodied despite the abv. Finish is gentle, fruity, and lightly dry.
